channel.title: How to change the start levels
channel.description:
Hello, how i can change the skill levels of a new account? i mean if a new account connect to my server, how can i change his start level skills? In my server the accounts start with al skills on 99, but i will that it start on 1 not on 99. Please help and sorry for my bad english.
Greets.

item.title: How to change the start levels
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

runescape, I know you’re trying to help by pointing in the right direction, but the first step you should do is get information from them about what what source/client/wheatever they are using so you can help them more clearly.

OP:

On a PI server, it’s found in Player.java
You’d look for something like, if not exactly:

	public Player(int _playerId) {

This is where the player object is first created. And, as you can see in the code, it sets all player levels to 1 except health, which is set to 10.

[code=java]
for (int i = 0; i < playerLevel.length; i++) {
if (i == 3) {
playerLevel[i] = 10;
} else {
playerLevel[i] = 1;
}
}

	for (int i = 0; i < playerXP.length; i++) {
		if (i == 3) {
			playerXP[i] = 1300;
		} else {
			playerXP[i] = 0;
		}
	}[/code]

All servers will have some form of this. Delta servers will probably have it in client.java, and anything newer I’m not familiar with.

Note: read the link in my signature for advice on posting server help topics. It will greatly help us, help you.

Read full topic
item.source: How to change the start levels

item.title: How to change the start levels
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Depending on what base you have, it’s different. For most servers(or most common servers) it is located in the Client.java file

It is somewhere under initialize()

(again, in probably wL servers)
